identifiers.title: Additional tender identifiers
identifiers.description: Additional identifiers for this tender. This field can be used to provide local identifiers for the tender.

bidOpening.title: Bid opening
bidOpening.description: The date, time, place and other details of the public bid opening.

communication.title: Communication
communication.description: Modalities of communication about key events.

contractTerms.title: Contract terms
contractTerms.description: Information about the terms governing the future contracts from the procedure.

coveredBy.title: Covered by
coveredBy.description: The international legal instruments that the contracting process is covered by.

designContest.title: Design contest
designContest.description: Information about the organization of a design contest.

essentialAssets.title: Essentials assets
essentialAssets.description: Information about the assets used for the provision of public services.

hasEssentialAssets.title: Has essential assets
hasEssentialAssets.description: Whether there is information about the assets used for the provision of public services.

reviewDetails.title: Review details
reviewDetails.description: Precise information concerning the time limits for the review procedures or contact information from which it can be obtained.

valueCalculationMethod.title: Value calculation method
valueCalculationMethod.description: The method used for calculating the estimated value of the concession.

legislativeReferences.title: Legislative references
legislativeReferences.description: Legislative references and associated contact points for information.

exclusionGrounds.title: Exclusion grounds
exclusionGrounds.description: Information about the criteria regarding the situation of a tenderer that can lead to its exclusion from the contracting process. For example: criminal convictions, bankruptcy, presence on a blacklist or failure to pay taxes.

crossBorderLaw.title: Cross-border law
crossBorderLaw.description: In case of joint procurement, the public procurement legislation that applies to the procedure.

legalBasis.title: Legal basis
legalBasis.description: The legal basis of the procedure.

deliveryLocations.title: Delivery Locations
deliveryLocations.description: The locations where activity related to this tender will take place.

deliveryAddresses.title: Delivery Addresses
deliveryAddresses.description: The addresses to which, or where, goods or services related to this tender will be delivered.

lots.title: Lots
lots.description: A tender process can be divided into lots, where bidders can bid on one or more lots. Details of each lot can be provided here. Items, documents and other features may then reference the lot they are related to using relatedLot. Where no relatedLots identifier is given, the values ought to be interpreted as applicable to the whole tender. Details about the whole tender can be overridden for a given lot through their inclusion in the lot object.

lotDetails.title: Lot Details
lotDetails.description: Details of any criteria that apply to bidding on the lots in this tender.

maximumLotsBidPerSupplier.title: Maximum lots per supplier
maximumLotsBidPerSupplier.description: The maximum number of lots that one supplier can bid on as part of this contracting process.

maximumLotsAwardedPerSupplier.title: Maximum lots per supplier
maximumLotsAwardedPerSupplier.description: The maximum number of lots that can be awarded to one supplier as part of this contracting process.

awardCriteriaDetails.title: Award criteria details
awardCriteriaDetails.description: Any detailed or further information on the award or selection criteria.

lotGroups.title: Lot groups
lotGroups.description: Where the buyer reserves the right to combine lots, or wishes to specify the total value for a group of lots, a lot group is used to capture this information.

hasOptions.title: Options used
hasOptions.description: Whether or not the buyer reserves the right to make additional purchases from the supplier, as long as the contract is valid.

otherRequirements.title: Other requirements
otherRequirements.description: Other requirements to participate in the procedure.

participationFees.title: Participation fees
participationFees.description: Any fees applicable to bidders wishing to participate in the tender process. Fees can apply for accessing bidding documents or for submitting bids, or there can be a "win fee" payable by the successful bidder.

procurementMethodRationaleClassification.title: Procurement method rationale classifications
procurementMethodRationaleClassification.description: The classifications of the procurement method rationale.

recurrence.title: Recurrence
recurrence.description: Information on the recurrence of the contracting process.

hasRecurrence.title: Has recurrence
hasRecurrence.description: Whether the contracting process is recurrent.

hasRenewal.title: Has renewal
hasRenewal.description: Whether the contracts can be renewed.

renewal.title: Renewal
renewal.description: The options for the renewal of the contracts.

secondStage.title: Second stage
secondStage.description: Information about the second stage of a two-stage procedure (e.g. a restricted procedure, a competitive procedure with negotiation, a competitive dialogue or an innovation partnership).

selectionCriteria.title: Selection criteria
selectionCriteria.description: The minimum requirements for potential suppliers to participate in the contracting process. Selection criteria ensure that a potential supplier has the legal and financial capacities and the technical and professional abilities to perform the contract.

mainProcurementCategoryDetails.title: Main Procurement Category Details
mainProcurementCategoryDetails.description: The local name of the Main Procurement Category

statusDetails.title: Status Details
statusDetails.description: Additional detail on the status of the tender. This field can be used to provide the local name of the status.

subcontractingTerms.title: Subcontracting terms
subcontractingTerms.description: Information about the terms governing subcontracting.

submissionTerms.title: Submission terms
submissionTerms.description: Information about the submission terms to describe how, when and where the tenderers need to submit their bids or expressions of interest for the procedure.

suitability.title: Suitability
suitability.description: Information about the suitability of the contracting process to different types of tenderers.

hasSustainability.title: Has sustainability
hasSustainability.description: Whether the contracting process incorporates Sustainable Public Procurement.

sustainability.title: Sustainability
sustainability.description: Information about how the contracting process incorporates Sustainable Public Procurement.

techniques.title: Techniques
techniques.description: Information about the use of techniques, such as framework agreements, dynamic purchasing systems and electronic auctions.

competitive.title: Is the framework agreement call-off competitive?
competitive.description: Whether this call-off is competitive or not.

maximumValue.title: Maximum value
maximumValue.description: The estimated maximum value of the framework agreement, as a whole, as estimated when making the award.

estimatedValue.title: Estimated value
estimatedValue.description: The estimated value of the framework agreement, as a whole, as estimated when making the award.

relatedBid.title: Related bid
relatedBid.description: The identifiers of the bids (or expressions of interest) to which the contract relates.

deprecated.description: This field is deprecated in favor of `relatedBids`, to allow an award to combine multiple bids.

relatedBids.title: Related bids
relatedBids.description: The identifiers of the bids (or expressions of interest) to which the award relates.

buyers.title: Buyers
buyers.description: The organizations aiming to conclude a contract with the suppliers or to use the goods, services or works resulting from the contract, if not identical to the buyers for the contracting process.

valueCalculationMethod.title: Value calculation method
valueCalculationMethod.description: Any details relevant to the value of the concession according to article 8(3) of Directive 2014/23/EU on concession contracts.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: The identifiers of the lots to which this award relates.

statusDetails.title: Status Details
statusDetails.description: Additional detail on the status of the award. This field can be used to provide the local name of the status.

hasSubcontracting.title: Subcontracting involved
hasSubcontracting.description: Whether a part of the contract will be subcontracted.

subcontracting.title: Subcontracting
subcontracting.description: Information about the parts of the contract that the supplier will subcontract to third parties.

identifiers.title: Additional contract identifiers
identifiers.description: Additional identifiers for this contract. This field can be used to provide local identifiers for the contract.

relatedBids.title: Related bids
relatedBids.description: The identifiers of the bids (or expressions of interest) to which the contract relates.

buyer.title: Buyer
buyer.description: The organization aiming to conclude a contract with the suppliers or to use the goods, services or works resulting from the contract, if not identical to the buyer for the contracting process.

periodRationale.title: Contract period rationale
periodRationale.description: The rationale for the duration of the contract.

publicPassengerTransportServicesKilomete.title: Kilometers of public passenger transport services
publicPassengerTransportServicesKilomete.description: The number of kilometers of public passenger transport services provided by a public service contract.

finance.title: Finance
finance.description: Information about financing arrangements for this contract.

statusDetails.title: Status Details
statusDetails.description: Additional detail on the status of the contract. This field can be used to provide the local name of the status

languages.title: Languages
languages.description: The languages used in the document, from the open [language](https://standard.open-contracting.org/{{version}}/{{lang}}/schema/codelists/#language) codelist. A [BCP47 language tag](https://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/) is allowed, if there is a user need for the additional information.

publisher.title: Publisher
publisher.description: The organization responsible for making the document available.

pageStart.title: Page start
pageStart.description: When the information referenced exists within a large document, indicate the first page on which it can be found. This should refer to the printed page number, not the page number reported by software applications.

pageEnd.title: Page end
pageEnd.description: When the information referenced exists within a large document, indicate the last page on which it can be found. This should refer to the printed page number, not the page number reported by software applications.

accessDetails.title: Access details
accessDetails.description: A description of any special arrangements needed to access this document, for example: registering for access, paying a fee, or visiting a location to inspect the document.

accessDetailsURL.title: Access details URL
accessDetailsURL.description: A web address for information on any special arrangements needed to access the document.

author.title: Author
author.description: The names of the authors of the document.

unofficialTranslations.title: Unofficial translations
unofficialTranslations.description: The languages in which unofficial translations of the document are available, from the open [language](https://standard.open-contracting.org/{{version}}/{{lang}}/schema/codelists/#language) codelist. A [BCP47 language tag](https://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/) is allowed, if there is a user need for the additional information.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: The identifiers of the lots to which this document relates.

SimpleIdentifier.title: Simple identifier
SimpleIdentifier.description: An unambiguous reference to a resource within a given context.

scheme.title: Scheme
scheme.description: The list, register or system from which the identifier is taken.

id.title: ID
id.description: The identifier taken from the scheme.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: The identifiers of the lots to which this amendment relates.

awardCriteria.title: Award criteria
awardCriteria.description: Information about the award criteria for the lot.

bidOpening.title: Bid opening
bidOpening.description: The date, time, place and other details of the public bid opening.

communication.title: Communication
communication.description: Modalities of communication about key events for this lot.

contractTerms.title: Contract terms
contractTerms.description: Information about the terms governing the future contracts for the lot.

coveredBy.title: Covered by
coveredBy.description: The international legal instruments that the lot is covered by.

designContest.title: Design contest
designContest.description: Information about the organization of a design contest.

essentialAssets.title: Essential assets
essentialAssets.description: Information about the assets used for the provision of public services.

hasEssentialAssets.title: Has essential assets
hasEssentialAssets.description: Whether there is information about the assets used for the provision of public services.

awardPeriod.title: Award period
awardPeriod.description: The period for decision making regarding the contract award for the lot. The end date should be the date on which an award decision is due to be finalized. The start date may be used to indicate the start of an evaluation period.

hasAccessibilityCriteria.title: Has accessibility criteria
hasAccessibilityCriteria.description: Whether the technical specifications for the lot include accessibility criteria for people with disabilities.

noAccessibilityCriteriaRationale.title: No accessibility criteria rationale
noAccessibilityCriteriaRationale.description: The rationale for not including accessibility criteria when the object of the lot is intended for use by natural persons.

reviewDetails.title: Review details
reviewDetails.description: Precise information concerning the time limits for the review procedures for the lot or contact information from which it can be obtained.

id.title: Lot ID
id.description: A local identifier for this lot, such as a lot number. This is used in relatedLots references at the item, document and award level.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: Identifiers for this lot. This field can be used to provide internal identifiers for the lot, such as identifiers from a buyer's document management system or procurement system.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of this lot.

status.title: Lot Status
status.description: The current status of the process related to this lot.

value.title: Lot value
value.description: The maximum estimated value of this lot.

minValue.title: Minimum value
minValue.description: The estimated minimum value of the lot. A negative value indicates that the contracting process may involve payments from the supplier to the buyer (commonly used in concession contracts).

tenderPeriod.title: Tender period
tenderPeriod.description: The period when this lot is open for submissions. The end date is the closing date for bid submissions.

contractPeriod.title: Contract period
contractPeriod.description: The period over which the contract is estimated or specified to be active. If the lot does not specify explicit dates, the duration field can be used.

buyer.title: Buyer
buyer.description: The organization aiming to conclude a contract with a supplier or to use the goods, works or services in this lot. This may be different from the procuring entity who may be specified in the tender data.

mainProcurementCategory.title: Main procurement category
mainProcurementCategory.description: The primary category describing the main object of this lot, using the closed procurementCategory codelist.

additionalProcurementCategories.title: Additional procurement categories
additionalProcurementCategories.description: Any additional categories describing the objects of this lot, using the open extendedProcurementCategory codelist.

enquiryPeriod.title: Enquiry period
enquiryPeriod.description: The period during which potential bidders may submit questions and requests for clarification about this lot to the buyer or the procuring entity.

submissionMethodDetails.title: Submission method details
submissionMethodDetails.description: Information about the methods by which bids are submitted for this lot. This can include the address, e-mail address or online service to which bids are submitted, and any special requirements to be followed for submissions. More structured information can be provided using the submission terms extension.

submissionTerms.title: Submission terms
submissionTerms.description: Information about the submission terms to describe how, when and where the tenderers need to submit their bids or expressions of interest for the lot.

hasOptions.title: Options used
hasOptions.description: Whether the buyer reserves the right to make additional purchases from the supplier, as long as the contract is valid.

otherRequirements.title: Other requirements
otherRequirements.description: Other requirements to participate in the lot.

recurrence.title: Recurrence
recurrence.description: Information on the recurrence of the lot.

hasRecurrence.title: Has recurrence
hasRecurrence.description: Whether the contracting process is recurrent.

hasRenewal.title: Has renewal
hasRenewal.description: Whether the contract related to the lot can be renewed.

renewal.title: Renewal
renewal.description: The options for the renewal of the contract related to the lot.

secondStage.title: Second stage
secondStage.description: Information about the second stage of a two-stage procedure (e.g. a restricted procedure, a competitive procedure with negotiation, a competitive dialogue or an innovation partnership).

selectionCriteria.title: Selection criteria
selectionCriteria.description: Information about the conditions for participation in a lot.

subcontractingTerms.title: Subcontracting terms
subcontractingTerms.description: Information about the terms governing subcontracting.

suitability.title: Suitability
suitability.description: Information about the suitability of the lot to different types of tenderers.

hasSustainability.title: Has sustainability
hasSustainability.description: Whether the lot incorporates Sustainable Public Procurement.

sustainability.title: Sustainability
sustainability.description: Information about how the lot incorporates Sustainable Public Procurement.

techniques.title: Techniques
techniques.description: Information about the use of techniques, such as framework agreements, dynamic purchasing systems and electronic auctions.

Lot.title: Lots
Lot.description: A lot is a grouping of items within a tender that can be bid on or awarded together.

awardCriteria.title: Award criteria
awardCriteria.description: Information about the award criteria for the lot.

id.title: Lot group identifier
id.description: A local identifier for this group of lots.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: Identifiers for this lot group. This field can be used to provide internal identifiers for the lot group, such as identifiers from a buyer's document management system or procurement system.

title.title: Title
title.description: A title for this lot group.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of this lot group.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: A list of the identifiers of the lots that form this group. Lots can appear in more than one group.

optionToCombine.title: Option to combine
optionToCombine.description: The buyer reserves the right to combine the lots in this group when awarding a contract.

maximumValue.title: Maximum value
maximumValue.description: The maximum estimated value of the lots in this group. This can be lower than the sum total of lot values

suitability.title: Suitability
suitability.description: Information about the suitability of the lot group to different types of tenderers.

techniques.title: Techniques
techniques.description: Information about the use of techniques, such as framework agreements, dynamic purchasing systems and electronic auctions.

LotGroup.title: Lot group
LotGroup.description: Where the buyer reserves the right to combine lots, or wishes to specify the total value for a group of lots, a lot group is used to capture this information.

weightingDescription.title: Complicated weighting description
weightingDescription.description: When the weighting cannot be expressed per criterion, the mathematical equation (or other description) that expresses the complicated (e.g. non-linear) weighting.

orderRationale.title: Justification for order of importance
orderRationale.description: The justification for only indicating the award criteria's order of importance, not their weighting.

type.title: Type
type.description: The aspect of the bid that the criterion concerns.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the criterion.

CriterionNumber.title: Criterion number
CriterionNumber.description: Information about a number linked to a criterion.

weight.title: Weight
weight.description: Whether the number is a type of weight.

fixed.title: Fixed
fixed.description: Whether the number is a fixed value.

threshold.title: Threshold
threshold.description: Whether the number is a type of threshold.

beneficialOwners.title: Beneficial owners
beneficialOwners.description: The beneficial owners of the organization.

listedOnRegulatedMarket.title: Listed on regulated market
listedOnRegulatedMarket.description: Whether the organization is listed on a regulated market (e.g. a stock exchange) that ensures adequate transparency in line with anti-money laundering legislation.

buyerProfile.title: Buyer profile URL
buyerProfile.description: The Web address of the buyer profile.

classifications.title: Organization classifications
classifications.description: The classifications that categorize the organization.

scale.title: Scale
scale.description: The size or scale of the organization.

eDeliveryGateway.title: eDelivery gateway
eDeliveryGateway.description: The organization's URL for the exchange of data and documents with eDelivery.

id.title: ID
id.description: A local identifier for the person.

name.title: Name
name.description: The full name of the person.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: An official identifier for the person. The scheme should follow the pattern {JURISDICTION}-{TYPE}, where JURISDICTION is a three-letter, uppercase ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 country code, and TYPE is one of "PASSPORT", "TAXID" or "IDCARD".

nationalities.title: Nationalities
nationalities.description: The nationalities of the person, from the closed country codelist.

email.title: Email
email.description: The e-mail address of the person.

faxNumber.title: Fax number
faxNumber.description: The fax number of the person. This must include the international dialing code.

telephone.title: Telephone
telephone.description: The telephone number of the person. This must include the international dialing code.

BidOpening.title: Bid opening
BidOpening.description: The date, time, place and other details of the public bid opening.

date.title: Date and time
date.description: The date and time of the bid opening.

location.title: Location
location.description: The place where the bid opening occurs.

address.title: Address
address.description: The address of the place where the bid opening occurs.

description.title: Details
description.description: Any other details about the bid opening (who can participate, whether authorization is needed, etc.).

Statistic.title: Statistic
Statistic.description: A summary statistic related to the contracting process.

id.title: ID
id.description: An internal identifier for the statistic.

measure.title: Measure
measure.description: The statistic reported in the value.

date.title: Date
date.description: The date when the statistic was last updated. This is often the closing date of the tender process. This field may be omitted unless either (a) the same statistic is provided from multiple points in time, or (b) there is a specific local requirement for the date when statistics were calculated to be provided.

value.title: Value
value.description: The value for the measure in question. A total count should be expressed as an integer. A proportion should be expressed as a decimal (for example, 0.1) and not as a percentage (for example, 10).

valueGross.title: Gross value
valueGross.description: The monetary value for the measure in question, including all taxes.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: The currency of the amount in the `value` field, if the statistic has a monetary value.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Any notes needed to understand or interpret the given statistic.

relatedLot.title: Related Lot
relatedLot.description: The identifiers of the lots to which the statistic relates. If left blank, the statistic will be interpreted as applying to the whole tender.

scope.title: Scope
scope.description: The scope of the statistic, from the closed statistic scope codelist.

Bid.title: Submission
Bid.description: A bid or expression of interest. Depending on the procedure, a bid can be an estimate, offer, proposal, quote or quotation. An expression of interest is also called a request to participate.

id.title: ID
id.description: A local identifier for the bid or expression of interest.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: Identifiers for this bid or expression of interest. This field can be used to provide internal identifiers for the submission, such as identifiers from a buyer's document management system or procurement system.

submissionType.title: Submission type
submissionType.description: The type of the submission, using the closed [submissionType](https://github.com/open-contracting-extensions/ocds_bid_extension/blob/master/codelists/submissionType.csv) codelist.

date.title: Date
date.description: The date when the bid or expression of interest was received.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the bid or expression of interest. The description field may be used to describe the terms and conditions for the submission.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the bid or expression of interest.

items.title: Items offered by the tenderer(s)
items.description: The goods, works or services offered by the tenderer(s), broken into line items wherever possible. Items should not be duplicated, but the quantity specified instead.

tenderers.title: Tenderer
tenderers.description: The organization(s) responsible for the bid or expression of interest.

value.title: Value
value.description: The total value of the bid (or expression of interest).

validityPeriod.title: Validity period
validityPeriod.description: The period for which the bid or expression of interest is valid.

documents.title: Documents
documents.description: All documents and attachments related to the bid or expression of interest and its evaluation.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: The identifiers of the lots to which the bid or expression of interest relates.

countriesOfOrigin.title: Countries of origin
countriesOfOrigin.description: The countries of origin of the items in the bid or expression of interest, from the closed country codelist. If a country is missing, [create an issue](https://github.com/open-contracting/standard/issues) to discuss the addition of a user-assigned code to the country codelist.

rank.title: Rank
rank.description: The position of the bid (i.e. whether the bid is ranked first, second, third, etc.) in a design contest, a framework agreement with multiple winners (e.g. cascades), an innovation partnership, a competitive dialogue, or another procedure.

variant.title: Is variant
variant.description: Whether the bid is a variant. A variant is a bid that fulfills the buyer's needs differently than as proposed in the procurement documents.

hasSubcontracting.title: Subcontracting involved
hasSubcontracting.description: Whether a part of the contract will be subcontracted to third parties.

subcontracting.title: Subcontracting
subcontracting.description: Information about the parts of the contract that will be subcontracted to third parties.

charges.title: Charges
charges.description: Information on the revenue to be raised through charges, as set out in the contract or as subsequently revised during the life of the project.

Charge.title: Charge
Charge.description: A charge to be incurred by users or government over the course of the contract. Charge information can be broken down by period. Information on the unit prices upon which total values are based can be provided in the tariffs section.

id.title: Charge identifier
id.description: A local identifier for this specific charge. This field is used to keep track of revisions of a charge across multiple OCDS releases.

title.title: Charge title
title.description: A descriptive title for this charge.

paidBy.title: Paid by
paidBy.description: Is this a user charge (paid by businesses or citizens using the facilities provided by the contract), or a charge paid by the government?

period.title: Period
period.description: The period to which this charge applies.

estimatedValue.title: Estimated value
estimatedValue.description: What is the estimated total value to be raised from this charge during this period.

actualValue.title: Actual value
actualValue.description: In the implementation section, this field may be updated with the total revenue raised from this charge during this period.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Any notes on this charge. This may include clarifying information.

Communication.title: Communication
Communication.description: Modalities of communication about key events.

atypicalToolName.title: Atypical tool name
atypicalToolName.description: The name of the tools and devices that are not generally available and that are required to communicate electronically with the buyer.

atypicalToolUrl.title: Atypical tool URL
atypicalToolUrl.description: The URL of the tools and devices that are not generally available and that are required to communicate electronically with the buyer.

noticePreferredPublicationDate.title: Notice preferred publication date
noticePreferredPublicationDate.description: The buyer's preferred date of publication of the notice (e.g. to avoid publication during a national holiday).

futureNoticeDate.title: Future notice date
futureNoticeDate.description: The estimated date of publication of the next sequential notice. For example, the next sequential notice for a planning notice might be a competition notice.

invitationToConfirmInterestDispatchDate.title: Invitation to confirm interest dispatch date
invitationToConfirmInterestDispatchDate.description: The estimated date of dispatch from the buyer to potential suppliers of the invitations to confirm interest. For example, when a planning notice is used as a call for competition, the buyer might simultaneously invite the potential suppliers that have expressed their interest to confirm their continuing interest.

documentAvailabilityPeriod.title: Document availability period
documentAvailabilityPeriod.description: The period during which documents can be accessed, or during which requests for access to documents can be submitted.

ContractTerms.title: Contract terms
ContractTerms.description: Information about the terms governing the future contracts.

electronicInvoicingPolicy.title: Electronic invoicing policy
electronicInvoicingPolicy.description: Whether the buyer will require, allow or not allow electronic invoices.

reservedExecution.title: Reserved execution
reservedExecution.description: Whether the execution of the contract is restricted to the framework of sheltered employment programmes.

performanceTerms.title: Terms performance
performanceTerms.description: The main information about the performance of the contract (e.g. intermediary deliverables, compensation for damages, intellectual property rights).

financialTerms.title: Financial terms
financialTerms.description: The main information about financing and payment and/or reference to any provisions that govern them.

tendererLegalForm.title: Tenderer legal form
tendererLegalForm.description: A certain legal form that must be taken by a group of tenderers that is awarded a contract.

hasExclusiveRights.title: Has exclusive rights
hasExclusiveRights.description: A right entitling a public service operator to operate certain public passenger transport services on a particular route or network or in a particular area, to the exclusion of any other such operator.

exclusiveRights.title: Exclusive rights
exclusiveRights.description: The nature and extent of the exclusive rights granted by the procuring entity to the supplier.

operatorRevenueShare.title: Operator revenue share
operatorRevenueShare.description: The proportion of revenue from the sale of tickets allocated to the supplier, expressed as a decimal between 0 and 1.

otherTerms.title: Other terms
otherTerms.description: Other contract terms that do not fit the semantics of any other OCDS field.

rewardsAndPenalties.title: Rewards and penalties
rewardsAndPenalties.description: Information about rewards and penalties relating to quality targets.

socialStandards.title: Social standards
socialStandards.description: The required social standards, for example: detail of the contractual rights of the staff concerned, and conditions under which employees are considered to be linked to the services.

hasNonDisclosureAgreement.title: Has non-disclosure agreement
hasNonDisclosureAgreement.description: Whether contract execution requires a non-disclosure agreement.

nonDisclosureAgreement.title: Non-disclosure agreement
nonDisclosureAgreement.description: A description of the non-disclosure agreement required for contract execution.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of this customer service requirement.

name.title: Name
name.description: A name for this customer service requirement.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of this customer service requirement.

country.title: Country code
country.description: The country, from the closed country codelist. If a country is missing, [create an issue](https://github.com/open-contracting/standard/issues) to discuss the addition of a user-assigned code to the country codelist.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the address.

DesignContest.title: Design contest
DesignContest.description: Information about the organization of a design contest.

selectedParticipants.title: Selected participants
selectedParticipants.description: The organizations that have already been selected to participate in the design contest.

hasPrizes.title: Has prizes
hasPrizes.description: Whether prizes will be awarded in the design contest.

prizes.title: Prizes
prizes.description: Information about the prizes awarded in the design contest.

rewardsDetails.title: Rewards details
rewardsDetails.description: The details and conditions of the payments to be made to the participants.

followUpContracts.title: Follow-up contracts
followUpContracts.description: Whether any contracts following the design contest will be awarded to the winner or winners of the design contest.

bindingJuryDecision.title: Binding jury decision
bindingJuryDecision.description: Whether the jury’s decision is binding on the procuring entity.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the jury member.

Prizes.title: Prizes
Prizes.description: Information about the prizes awarded in a design contest.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the prizes.

Prize.title: Prize
Prize.description: Information about an individual prize awarded in a design contest.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: The locally unique identifier for the prize.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the prize.

EssentialAsset.title: Essential asset
EssentialAsset.description: Information about the asset used for the provision of public services.

description.title: Description
description.description: Description of the essential asset.

significance.title: Significance
significance.description: Estimated percentage share of the essential asset provided in relation to the overall asset needed for the provision of the public services.

predominance.title: Predominance
predominance.description: Estimated percentage share of asset provided compared to asset used for activities other than the public services.

deliveryAddresses.title: Delivery Addresses
deliveryAddresses.description: The addresses to which, or where, goods or services related to this tender, contract or license will be delivered.

deliveryLocations.title: Delivery Locations
deliveryLocations.description: The locations where activity related to this tender, contract or license will be delivered.

deliveryLocation.title: Delivery Location
deliveryLocation.description: The location where activity related to this tender, contract or license will be delivered, or will take place.

deprecated.description: This field is deprecated in favour of `.deliveryLocations` to support items with multiple delivery locations.

deliveryAddress.title: Delivery Address
deliveryAddress.description: The address to which, or where, goods or services related to this tender, contract or license will be delivered.

deprecated.description: This field is deprecated in favour of `.deliveryAddresses` to support items with multiple delivery locations.

relatedLot.title: Related lot
relatedLot.description: The identifier of the lot to which this item relates.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the period.

LegislativeReference.title: Legislative reference
LegislativeReference.description: Legislative reference and associated contact point

title.title: Title
title.description: The title of the legislative reference

url.title: URL
url.description: A link to the Web page of the legislative reference.

informationService.title: Information service
informationService.description: An organization that can provide information about the legislative reference.

ExclusionGrounds.title: Exclusion grounds
ExclusionGrounds.description: Information about the criteria regarding the situation of a tenderer that can lead to its exclusion from the contracting process. For example: criminal convictions, bankruptcy, presence on a blacklist or failure to pay taxes.

ExclusionCriterion.title: Exclusion criterion
ExclusionCriterion.description: A criterion regarding the situation of a tenderer that can lead to its exclusion from the contracting process.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the criterion.

finance.title: Finance
finance.description: Information about financing arrangements for a future contracting process.

Finance.title: Financing arrangement
Finance.description: An arrangement between two parties for raising money.

id.title: ID
id.description: An identifier for this financing arrangement.

title.title: Title
title.description: A short title for this financing arrangement.

description.title: Description
description.description: A short description of this financing arrangement. This may include details of service fees, commitment fees, lender rights, step in arrangements, exchange rate guarantees, and for syndicated loans, details of syndication and any members of the syndicate.

value.title: Value
value.description: The total value of this finance.

financingParty.title: Financing organization
financingParty.description: The organization providing this financing arrangement.

financingPartyType.title: Financing organization type
financingPartyType.description: The type of the financing organization, from the closed financingPartyType codelist.

source.title: Funding source
source.description: The source of funds for this financing arrangement. For example, the Green Climate Fund.

assetClass.title: Asset class
assetClass.description: The asset classes used in this financing arrangement, from the closed assetClass codelist.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of this financing arrangement, from the closed financingArrangementType codelist.

repaymentPriority.title: Repayment priority
repaymentPriority.description: The order in which the debt in this financing arrangement will be repaid in case of default, from the closed debtRepaymentPriority codelist.

concessional.title: Concessional
concessional.description: Whether this financing arrangement is provided below market rate in order to accelerate climate or development objectives. Also called soft financing and subsidized funding.

resultsBased.title: Results based
resultsBased.description: Whether payments under this financing arrangement are contingent on the achievement of pre-defined results.

period.title: Finance period
period.description: The period covered by this financing arrangement. Also called maturity.

paymentPeriod.title: Payment period
paymentPeriod.description: The period over which the borrower in this financing arrangement is obliged to make payments.

paymentFrequency.title: Payment frequency (days)
paymentFrequency.description: The average payment frequency (in days) of this financing arrangement. For example, 365 for yearly, 30.4 for monthly, or 1 for daily.

interestRate.title: Interest rate
interestRate.description: The interest rate associated with this finance.

base.title: Base
base.description: The variable to which an additional margin amount is added to get the interest amount. This can be specified as a fixed number, as a known variable (e.g. LIBOR or LIBOR+1%), or can be omitted if margin specifies the entire interest rate.

margin.title: Margin
margin.description: The variable added to the base to give the interest amount, expressed as a decimal (for example, 0.1) and not as a percentage (for example, 10).

fixed.title: Fixed rate
fixed.description: A boolean field. If this interest rate of fixed, set to true. Otherwise, set to false.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: Any explanatory notes concerning the interest rate.

exchangeRateGuarantee.title: Exchange rate guarantees
exchangeRateGuarantee.description: Whether there is an associated exchange rate guarantee with this source of finance.

stepInRights.title: Step in rights
stepInRights.description: Whether provision of this finance confers any step in rights to the financing organization.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: The identifiers of the lots to which this financing arrangement relates.

description.title: Description
description.description: A name or description of this location. This might include the name(s) of the location(s), or might provide a human-readable description of the location to be covered.

geometry.title: Geometry
geometry.description: We follow the [GeoJSON standard](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7946) to express basic location information, using longitude, latitude, and optional elevation values in the [WGS84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System) (EPSG:4326) projection. A point location can be identified by geocoding an address. For concession licenses, or other scenarios covering a polygon location that is not contained in a known gazetteer, polygon and multi-polygon can be used.

type.title: Type
type.description: The type of [GeoJSON Geometry Objects](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc7946#section-3.1) being provided. To provide longitude, latitude, and optional elevation, use 'Point', and enter an array of [longitude, latitude] or [longitude, latitude, elevation] as the value of the coordinates field: e.g. [-122.085, 37.42].

coordinates.title: Coordinates
coordinates.description: The relevant array of points, e.g. [longitude, latitude] or [longitude, latitude, elevation], or a nested array of points, for the GeoJSON geometry being described. The longitude and latitude must be expressed in decimal degrees in the WGS84 (EPSG:4326) projection.

gazetteer.title: Gazetteer
gazetteer.description: Identifiers from a gazetteer (a geographical index or directory) for the location.

scheme.title: Gazetteer scheme
scheme.description: The identifier of the gazetteer. The `locationGazetteers.csv` codelist provides details of services, where available, that can resolve a gazetteer entry to provide location names.

identifiers.title: Identifiers
identifiers.description: An array of one or more codes drawn from the gazetteer indicated by the `scheme` field.

uri.title: URI
uri.description: A URI to a further description of the location. This might be a human-readable document with information on the location, or a machine-readable description of the location.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: The identifiers of the lots to which this milestone relates.

relatedLots.title: Related lot(s)
relatedLots.description: The identifiers of the lots in the related process to which this process relates.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the options.

period.title: Period
period.description: The period over which the options can be used.

OtherRequirements.title: Other requirements
OtherRequirements.description: Other requirements to participate in the procedure or lot.

requiresStaffNamesAndQualifications.title: Requires staff names and qualifications
requiresStaffNamesAndQualifications.description: Whether the bidders are obligated to indicate the names and professional qualifications of the staff assigned to performing the contract.

reservedParticipation.title: Reserved participation
reservedParticipation.description: The types of organizations to which participation is reserved.

qualificationSystemConditions.title: Qualification system conditions
qualificationSystemConditions.description: The conditions to be fulfilled by candidates in view of their qualification for the system.

qualificationSystemMethods.title: Qualification system methods
qualificationSystemMethods.description: The methods according to which each of the qualification system conditions will be verified.

reductionCriteria.title: Reduction criteria
reductionCriteria.description: The criteria or rules for selecting a limited number of qualified candidates to submit bids.

securityClearance.title: Security clearance
securityClearance.description: Information about the required security clearance (e.g. which clearance level is needed, which team members need it, whether it is needed already for accessing documents or only for contract execution).

ParticipationFee.title: Participation fee
ParticipationFee.description: A fee applicable to bidders wishing to participate in the tender process. Fees can apply for accessing bidding documents or for submitting bids, or there can be a "win fee" payable by the successful bidder.

id.title: Fee ID
id.description: A local identifier for this fee, unique within this block. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a fee through the compilation from release to record mechanism.

value.title: Value
value.description: The monetary value of this fee.

relativeValue.title: Relative value
relativeValue.description: The value of the participation fee, as a proportion of a monetary value.

description.title: Description
description.description: Additional information about this fee, for example: the specific cases in which the fee is applicable (e.g. hard copies of documents only), the way in which the fee is levied, or the exact nature of the fee.

methodOfPayment.title: Method(s) of payment
methodOfPayment.description: The accepted ways in which fees can be paid.

RelativeValue.title: Relative value
RelativeValue.description: The value of the participation fee, as a proportion of a monetary value.

proportion.title: Proportion
proportion.description: The proportion of the monetary value, expressed as a decimal between 0 and 1.

monetaryValue.title: Monetary value
monetaryValue.description: The name of the monetary value.

isAccelerated.title: Accelerated procedure used
isAccelerated.description: Whether the time limit for receipt of bids or expressions of interest can be reduced due to a state of urgency.

acceleratedRationale.title: Accelerated procedure rationale
acceleratedRationale.description: The justification for using an accelerated procedure.

features.title: Features
features.description: The main features of the procedure (e.g. description of the individual stages) and information about where the full rules for the procedure can be found.

Recurrence.title: Recurrence
Recurrence.description: Information on the recurrence of the contracting process.

dates.title: Estimated dates
dates.description: An estimate of the timing of subsequent initiations of contracting processes (e.g. notices of intended procurement).

description.title: Further information
description.description: Any further information on the recurrence of the contracting process.

Renewal.title: Renewal
Renewal.description: Information about the options for the renewal of a contract.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the options for the renewal of the contract.

maximumRenewals.title: Maximum renewal
maximumRenewals.description: The maximum number of renewals. If there is no maximum, set to 1e9999 (which parses to infinity).

period.title: Renewal period
period.description: The period over which the contract can be renewed.

SecondStage.title: Second stage
SecondStage.description: Information about the second stage of a two-stage procedure (e.g. a restricted procedure, a competitive procedure with negotiation, a competitive dialogue or an innovation partnership).

minimumCandidates.title: Minimum number of candidates
minimumCandidates.description: The minimum number of candidates to be invited for the second stage of the procedure. If there is an exact limit on the number of candidates, set `minimumCandidates` and `maximumCandidates` to the same number.

maximumCandidates.title: Maximum number of candidates
maximumCandidates.description: The maximum number of candidates to be invited for the second stage of the procedure. If there is an exact limit on the number of candidates, set `minimumCandidates` and `maximumCandidates` to the same number.

successiveReduction.title: Successive reduction
successiveReduction.description: The procedure will take place in successive stages. In each stage, some participants might be eliminated.

noNegotiationNecessary.title: No negotiation necessary
noNegotiationNecessary.description: The buyer or procuring entity reserves the right to award the contract on the basis of the initial bids without any further negotiations.

invitationDate.title: Invitation date
invitationDate.description: The estimated date of dispatch of the invitations to participate or to submit bids.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the criteria.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the criterion.

minimum.title: Minimum value or level
minimum.description: The minimum value or level of compliance a candidate needs to meet in order to participate.

appliesTo.title: Applies to
appliesTo.description: Whether the criterion applies to suppliers, subcontractors, or both.

forReduction.title: For reduction?
forReduction.description: Whether the criterion is used to select the potential suppliers to be invited to the second stage of the contracting process, if the number of invitations is limited.

verificationMethod.title: Verification method
verificationMethod.description: The methods the buyer or procuring entity uses to verify the potential supplier satisfies the criterion.

SubcontractingTerms.title: Subcontracting terms
SubcontractingTerms.description: The obligations of the suppliers who subcontract.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the terms governing subcontracting.

competitiveMaximumPercentage.title: Maximum percentage of contract value for competitive subcontracting
competitiveMaximumPercentage.description: The maximum percentage of the contract value that the buyer or procuring entity allows the supplier to subcontract to third parties through a competitive procedure, expressed as a decimal proportion between 0 and 1.

competitiveMinimumPercentage.title: Minimum percentage of contract value for competitive subcontracting
competitiveMinimumPercentage.description: The minimum percentage of the contract value that the buyer or procuring entity requires the supplier to subcontract to third parties through a competitive procedure, expressed as a decimal proportion between 0 and 1.

Subcontracting.title: Subcontracting
Subcontracting.description: Information about the parts of the contract that will be subcontracted to third parties.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the part of the contract that will be subcontracted to third parties.

maximumPercentage.title: Maximum percentage of contract value
maximumPercentage.description: The maximum percentage of the contract value that will be subcontracted, expressed as a decimal proportion between 0 and 1.

minimumPercentage.title: Minimum percentage of contract value
minimumPercentage.description: The minimum percentage of the contract value that will be subcontracted, expressed as a decimal proportion between 0 and 1.

competitiveMaximumPercentage.title: Maximum percentage of contract value for competitive subcontracting
competitiveMaximumPercentage.description: The maximum percentage of the contract value that the buyer or procuring entity allows the supplier to subcontract to third parties through a competitive procedure, expressed as a decimal proportion between 0 and 1.

competitiveMinimumPercentage.title: Minimum percentage of contract value for competitive subcontracting
competitiveMinimumPercentage.description: The minimum percentage of the contract value that the buyer or procuring entity requires the supplier to subcontract to third parties through a competitive procedure, expressed as a decimal proportion between 0 and 1.

value.title: Subcontracted value
value.description: The estimated value of the part of the contract that will be subcontracted to third parties.

competitive.title: Competitive subcontracting
competitive.description: Whether the supplier will subcontract part of the contract to third parties through a competitive procedure.

subcontracts.title: Subcontracts
subcontracts.description: Information about the subcontracts that will be established.

Subcontract.title: Subcontract
Subcontract.description: A relationship that suppliers establish with a third party to perform part of the contract on their behalf.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: The locally unique identifier for the subcontract.

subcontractor.title: Subcontractor
subcontractor.description: The organization that performs part of the contract on behalf of the suppliers.

mainContractors.title: Main contractors
mainContractors.description: The organizations to which the subcontractor will be subcontracted, if they are a subset of the tenderers submitting the bid or the suppliers receiving the award.

SubmissionTerms.title: Submission terms
SubmissionTerms.description: Information about the submission terms to describe how, when and where the tenderers need to submit their bids or expressions of interest.

electronicSubmissionPolicy.title: Electronic submission policy
electronicSubmissionPolicy.description: Whether tenderers are required, allowed or not allowed to submit bids or expressions of interest electronically.

variantPolicy.title: Variant policy
variantPolicy.description: Whether tenderers are required, allowed or not allowed to submit bids which fulfill the buyer's needs differently than as proposed in the procurement documents.

electronicCatalogPolicy.title: Electronic catalog policy
electronicCatalogPolicy.description: Whether tenderers are required, allowed or not allowed to submit bids as electronic catalogs. An electronic catalog is an electronic format (typically prescribed by the buyer) that participants in the contracting process need to follow when exchanging information about technical specifications, evaluation criteria, bids, lots, etc.

languages.title: Submission language
languages.description: One or more languages in which bids or expressions of interest can be submitted, using either two-letter [ISO639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes), or extended [BCP47 language tags](http://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/). The use of lowercase two-letter codes from [ISO639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) is recommended.

bidValidityPeriod.title: Bid validity period
bidValidityPeriod.description: The period, from the bid submission deadline, for which bids must remain valid.

depositsGuarantees.title: Deposits and guarantees
depositsGuarantees.description: Information about the deposits or guarantees required from the tenderers.

advancedElectronicSignatureRequired.title: Advanced electronic signature required
advancedElectronicSignatureRequired.description: Whether an advanced or qualified electronic signature or seal is needed.

multipleBidsAllowed.title: Multiple bids allowed
multipleBidsAllowed.description: Whether tenderers can submit more than one bid.

subcontractingClauses.title: Subcontracting clauses
subcontractingClauses.description: The information about subcontracting that needs to be provided in the bid.

rationale.title: Rationale
rationale.description: The rationale for electronic submission not being allowed.

address.title: Address
address.description: The address to which non-electronic bids or expressions of interest should be submitted.

Suitability.title: Suitability
Suitability.description: Information about the suitability of a contracting process, lot or lot group to different types of tenderers.

sme.title: Small and medium enterprises
sme.description: Whether the contracting process, lot or lot group is suitable to small and medium enterprises.

Sustainability.title: Sustainability
Sustainability.description: Information about how the contracting process or lot incorporates Sustainable Public Procurement.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of how the contracting process or lot incorporates Sustainable Public Procurement.

goal.title: Goal
goal.description: The sustainability goal pursued, from the sustainabilityGoal codelist. New sub-codes may be used outside those in the codelist, following the format [existing-code].[sub-code].

strategies.title: Strategies
strategies.description: The strategies used to pursue the sustainability goal(s), from the sustainabilityStrategy codelist.

Techniques.title: Techniques
Techniques.description: Information about the use of techniques, such as framework agreements, dynamic purchasing systems and electronic auctions.

hasFrameworkAgreement.title: Framework agreement involved
hasFrameworkAgreement.description: Whether a framework agreement is involved.

hasDynamicPurchasingSystem.title: Dynamic purchasing system involved
hasDynamicPurchasingSystem.description: Whether a dynamic purchasing system is involved.

dynamicPurchasingSystem.title: Dynamic purchasing system
dynamicPurchasingSystem.description: Information about the dynamic purchasing system.

hasElectronicAuction.title: Electronic auction used
hasElectronicAuction.description: Whether an electronic auction is used.

minimumParticipants.title: Minimum number of participants
minimumParticipants.description: The minimum number of participants in the framework agreement.

maximumParticipants.title: Maximum number of participants
maximumParticipants.description: The maximum number of participants in the framework agreement. If there is no maximum, set to 1e9999 (which parses to infinity).

method.title: Method
method.description: Whether contracts are awarded with, without, or both with and without the reopening of competition.

periodRationale.title: Duration rationale
periodRationale.description: The justification for exceptional cases when the duration of a framework agreement exceeds the legal limits.

buyerCategories.title: Buyer categories
buyerCategories.description: Any additional categories of buyers participating in the framework agreement and not mentioned by name (e.g. 'all hospitals in the Tuscany region').

value.title: Value
value.description: The total upper estimated value of the framework agreement.

period.title: Period
period.description: The period over which the framework agreement is estimated to be active.

description.title: Description
description.description: A summary description of the framework agreement. This complements any structured information provided using the other fields.

DynamicPurchasingSystem.title: Dynamic purchasing system
DynamicPurchasingSystem.description: Information about the dynamic purchasing system.

type.title: Type
type.description: In the case of central purchasing bodies, whether the dynamic purchasing system can be used by buyers not listed in the contracting process.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the dynamic purchasing system.

url.title: URL
url.description: The internet address of the electronic auction.

description.title: Description
description.description: Any additional information about the electronic auction.

WithheldInformationItem.title: Withheld information item
WithheldInformationItem.description: An item of information whose publication is temporarily or permanently withheld.

id.title: ID
id.description: The locally unique identifier for the withheld information item.

field.title: Field
field.description: The identifier of the field with which the withheld information would otherwise be published.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name or title of the field with which the withheld information would otherwise be published.

availabilityDate.title: Availability date
availabilityDate.description: The date on which the withheld information will be published.

rationale.title: Rationale
rationale.description: The rationale for withholding the information.

rationaleClassifications.title: Rationale classifications
rationaleClassifications.description: Classifications of the rationale for withholding the information.

bids.title: Submissions
bids.description: Information about individual bids and expressions of interest, and summary statistics.

statistics.title: Statistics
statistics.description: Summary statistics about the number of bidders, bids and expressions of interest.

details.title: Submission details
details.description: Information about individual bids and expressions of interest.

title.title: Title
title.description: A overall title for this contracting process or release.

description.title: Description
description.description: An overall description of this contracting process or release. This does not replace a detailed breakdown of the objects of the contracting process in the planning, tender, award or contracts section.

withheldInformation.title: Withheld information
withheldInformation.description: Details of items of information whose publication is temporarily or permanently withheld.
